description: framed sampler with brown, tan, red, green, blue and yellow embroidery; floral edging with house and foliage at bottom; birds, deer, a pair of angels and plants throughout
markings: \'Blest soul that can say/Christ only I seek/wait for him alway/Be constant tho\' weak/The Lord whom thou seekes/Will not tarry long/And to him the weakest/Is dear as the strong\', in light red floss, at top; \'Mary Ann Duffield [?]/Aged 10 years/Why should I complain of want or distress/Temptation or Pain He told me no less/The heirs of salvation I know from his word/Thro much tribulation must follow their Lord\', in brown floss, below first inscription; \'Horace Brown [underlined]\', in black ink, on backing paper near top; \'Mr. and Mrs. Jeremy Brown/NORTH MOWING/Springfield/Vermont\', on label, tacked to back of frame at UL corner; \'#6\', in pencil, below label
medium: Wool and silk thread on wool plain weave; needlework
text: Many samplers included moralizing sayings and religious verses. This one issues a reminder that “The Lord whom thou seekes will not tarry long and to him the weakest is dear as the strong.” Embroideries like these were designed to instill both practical expertise and spiritual fortitude.
title: Sampler
